citations.narrative:
The outdoor red-tailed hawk enclosure does not have adequate shelter to protect the animal during inclement weather.
Currently the red-tailed hawk has plywood on two sides in the lower right corner of the enclosure with a roof on top of the
plywood. Temperature was 26 degrees Fahrenheit with a southwest wind speed of 8 mph at time of inspection.
Inadequate shelter during inclement weather such low temperatures and strong winds can affect the comfort and health of
animals. Correct by providing a shelter box or shelter structure in the enclosure to protect the hawk during inclement
weather.
This is a 1st re-license inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 17, 2025 counted from 1st re-license inspection or
the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact inspector to schedule your next
re-license inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
